intro_content.overview: In the Highland Bikes project, high bounce rates at checkout and the absence of a user-friendly product comparison feature were identified through comprehensive research and competitive analysis. This led to iterative design phases, revamping the checkout process for improved intuitiveness and introducing a visually engaging mobile interface. Through user testing and iterative refinement, user needs were prioritized, resulting in a more seamless and enjoyable shopping experience.
intro_content.contributions: I spearheaded UX/UI enhancements for Highland Bikes' eCommerce platform, focusing on optimizing checkout flow and introducing a user-friendly product comparison feature. Through research, iterative design, and user testing, I revamped the checkout process for improved intuitiveness and created a visually engaging mobile interface.

problem.top: Highland Bikes has been grappling with elevated bounce rates during the checkout phase. Upon closer examination, it appears that the mandatory account creation process might be a key contributor to this issue.
problem.bottom: Additionally, customers have been encountering decision fatigue while selecting a bike for purchase. The absence of a feasible method to compare bikes side by side within the mobile interface exacerbates this challenge.

goals.text: Make the checkout process more intuitive for the user.
Allow users to compare products from the palm of their hand.
Create a compelling design that appeals to the user.

process.text: Affinity Mapping, Personas, Empathy Mapping, User Stories
Pen & Paper Ideation, Information Architecture, Wire flows, High-Fidelity Wireframes, UI Kits
Paper Prototype, Low-Fidelity Prototype, High-Fidelity Prototype
Usability Testing, Refine, Redesign, and Iterate
